choices.A: The domain's processor compatibility is not met.
choices.D: The laptop does not have all current Windows updates installed.
choices.B: The laptop has Windows 10 Home installed.
choices.C: The laptop does not have an onboard Ethernet adapter.

questions.question_text: A technician is unable to join a Windows 10 laptop to a domain. Which of the following is the MOST likely reason?

discussion.content: Noticed on the 220-1102 test back in January 2023

Selected Answer: B
According to this Microsoft forum post, you need to upgrade to Windows 10 Pro in order to join a domain:

https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/all/how-to-add-windows-10-home-edition-to-a-domain/ec15d3c4-75bb-487b-a58f-9c3135580bed

comments.content: And WIn10 Home does not have the join domain or BitLocker.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Windows 10 Home edition does not support joining a domain. Domain joining capability is a feature typically found in Windows 10 Professional, Enterprise, and Education editions. Therefore, if the laptop has Windows 10 Home installed, it will not be able to join a domain.

Options A, C, and D are less likely to be the cause of the issue

Selected Answer: B
To join a domain on Windows 10, Windows 11, and earlier, you'll need to have the Pro, Education, or Enterprise edition version of the operating system. On a Mac, you can join a domain using the Directory Utility tool.

questions.question_text: A corporate smartphone was stored for five months after setup. During this time, the company did not have any system updates. When the phone is turned on, an application runs, but it crashes intermittently. Which of the following should a technician do next?

comments.content: The app crashes, not the OS. so C is the best answer

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Reimage the OS.

Given the symptoms described (crashing application after a period of storage without system updates), reimaging the operating system (OS) is a reasonable next step for a technician.

Explanation:


Reimage the OS (Option B): If the smartphone has been stored for five months without system updates and is now experiencing intermittent crashes, there may be underlying issues with the operating system. Reimaging the OS involves reinstalling a clean, up-to-date version of the operating system, which can address potential corruption or compatibility issues.

Selected Answer: B
B ist richtig

D. Clear the cache.
Clearing the cache can often resolve issues caused by outdated or corrupted temporary files. In this case, the phone was inactive for an extended period, which could have led to cache corruption. Clearing the cache will remove these corrupted files and potentially resolve the issue.

If clearing the cache doesn't resolve the issue, the technician can move on to more advanced troubleshooting steps, such as reinstalling the application or reimaging the OS.

Selected Answer: D
CompTIA always wants you to start with the least drastic fix which in this case is clearing the cache.
why am i "reinstalling the application "wouldn't i want to "update the application" another bad language question.
I guess I'm not understanding, why not clear the cache BEFORE reinstalling the app?

Selected Answer: C
reinstall to get the application latest update.

Selected Answer: C
Update that applications first, than clear caches .

Selected Answer: C
The app crashes, not the phone. You need to update the application prior to reimagining the whole system.

Selected Answer: B
Some of the applications can be eating data as well by running in the background causing a slowdown.

Selected Answer: B
Too many processes running üèÉ.

questions.question_text: A remote user's smartphone is performing very slowly. The user notices that the performance improves slightly after rebooting but then reverts back to performing slowly. The user also notices that the phone does not get any faster after connecting to the company's corporate guest network. A technician sees that the phone has a large number of applications installed on it. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the issue?

choices.B: The user has too many processes running.
choices.C: The smartphone has malware on it.
choices.A: The user is in a poor signal area.

questions.question_text: A technician is installing RAM in a new workstation and needs to protect against electrostatic discharge. Which of the following will best resolve this concern?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The Answer is C

choices.A: Confirm the user can ping the default gateway.
choices.D: Open port 3389 on the Windows firewall.
choices.C: Change the subnet mask on the user's laptop.
choices.B: Change the IP address on the user's laptop.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
RDP is using port 3389.
